## harp-materials package

## Classes

|  Class | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [CirclePointsMaterial](./harp-materials.circlepointsmaterial.md) | Material designed to render circle points. Note that it is always transparent since the circle shape is created with an alpha channel to benefit an antialising that a mere <code>discard</code> could not bring. |
|  [CopyMaterial](./harp-materials.copymaterial.md) | The material is used for composing. |
|  [DisplacementFeatureMixin](./harp-materials.displacementfeaturemixin.md) |  |
|  [EdgeMaterial](./harp-materials.edgematerial.md) | Material designed to render the edges of extruded buildings using GL\_LINES. It supports solid colors, vertex colors, color mixing and distance fading. |
|  [ExtrusionFeatureMixin](./harp-materials.extrusionfeaturemixin.md) | Mixin class for extended THREE materials. Adds new properties required for <code>extrusionRatio</code>.<!-- -->There is some special handling for the extrusionRatio property, which is animated via \[\[AnimatedExtrusionHandler\]\] that is using \[\[extrusionRatio\]\] setter and getter to update extrusion in a way that works well with the mixin and EdgeMaterial. |
|  [FadingFeatureMixin](./harp-materials.fadingfeaturemixin.md) | Mixin class for extended THREE materials. Adds new properties required for <code>fadeNear</code> and <code>fadeFar</code>. There is some special handling for the fadeNear/fadeFar properties, which get some setters and getters in a way that works well with the mixin. \[\[Tile\#addRenderHelper\]\] |
|  [GroundAtmosphereMaterial](./harp-materials.groundatmospherematerial.md) |  |
|  [HighPrecisionLineMaterial](./harp-materials.highprecisionlinematerial.md) | Material designed to render high precision lines (ideal for position-sensible data). |
|  [HighPrecisionPointMaterial](./harp-materials.highprecisionpointmaterial.md) | Material designed to render high precision points (ideal for position-sensible data). |
|  [IconMaterial](./harp-materials.iconmaterial.md) | 2D material for icons, similar to \[\[TextMaterial\]\]. Uses component in texture coordinates to apply opacity. |
|  [MapMeshBasicMaterial](./harp-materials.mapmeshbasicmaterial.md) | Subclass of \[\[THREE.MeshBasicMaterial\]\]. Adds new properties required for \[\[fadeNear\]\] and \[\[fadeFar\]\]. In addition to the new properties (which update their respective uniforms), it is also required to update the material in their objects \[\[onBeforeRender\]\] and \[\[OnAfterRender\]\] calls, where their flag \[\[transparent\]\] is set and the internal fadeNear/fadeFar values are updated to world space distances. \[\[Tile\#addRenderHelper\]\] |
|  [MapMeshDepthMaterial](./harp-materials.mapmeshdepthmaterial.md) |  |
|  [MapMeshStandardMaterial](./harp-materials.mapmeshstandardmaterial.md) | Subclass of THREE.MeshStandardMaterial. Adds new properties required for <code>fadeNear</code> and <code>fadeFar</code>. In addition to the new properties (which fill respective uniforms), it is also required to update the material in their objects <code>onBeforeRender</code> and <code>OnAfterRender</code> calls, where their flag <code>transparent</code> is set and the internal fadeNear/fadeFar values are updated to world space distances. \[\[Tile\#addRenderHelper\]\] |
|  [MSAAMaterial](./harp-materials.msaamaterial.md) | The material to use for the quad of the \[\[MSAARenderPass\]\] in the composing. |
|  [SkyAtmosphereMaterial](./harp-materials.skyatmospherematerial.md) |  |
|  [SolidLineMaterial](./harp-materials.solidlinematerial.md) | Material designed to render solid variable-width lines. |

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [disableBlending(material)](./harp-materials.disableblending.md) | Disable alpha blending using THREE.CustomBlending mode, switches to \[\[THREE.NormalBlending\]\]. Blending mode change does not require material update.  THREE.Material.needsUpdate.  enableBlending. |
|  [enableBlending(material)](./harp-materials.enableblending.md) | Enable alpha blending using THREE.CustomBlending setup.<!-- -->Function enables blending using one of predefined modes, for both color and alpha components: - Src: \[\[THREE.SrcAlphaFactor\]\], Dst: \[\[THREE.OneMinusSrcAlphaFactor\]\] - Src: \[\[THREE.OneFactor\]\], Dst: \[\[THREE.OneMinusSrcAlphaFactor\]\] The second blending equation is used when \[\[THREE.Material.premultipliedAlpha\]\] is enabled for this material.  Blending mode change does not require material update.  THREE.Material.needsUpdate. |
|  [enforceBlending(material)](./harp-materials.enforceblending.md) | THREE.js is enabling blending only when transparent is <code>true</code> or when a blend mode different than <code>NormalBlending</code> is set. Since we don't want to set transparent to true and mess up the render order we set <code>CustomBlending</code> with the same parameters as the <code>NormalBlending</code>. |
|  [getShaderDefine(defines, key)](./harp-materials.getshaderdefine.md) | Acquire shader 'define' value from <code>defines</code> map.<!-- -->If there is no value under \[\[key\]\] specified, function returns false, otherwise result is true or numeric value if there is a number stored. |
|  [getShaderMaterialDefine(material, key, fallbackValue)](./harp-materials.getshadermaterialdefine.md) | Acquire value of \[\[THREE.ShaderMaterial\]\] GPU shader preprocessor define.<!-- -->The semantic used in entire engine assumes that preprocessor defines may have only binary (defined / not defined) or numerical values, this ensures consistency in the shaders and materials code.  If \_define\_ with \[\[key\]\] is \_undefined\_ function returns \[\[false\]\], if defined but not numerical value it returns \[\[true\]\], otherwise returns number.  setShaderMaterialDefine. |
|  [hasDisplacementFeature(material)](./harp-materials.hasdisplacementfeature.md) | Determines whether a given material supports displacement maps for elevation overlay. |
|  [insertShaderInclude(shaderContent, shaderName, insertedShaderName, addTab)](./harp-materials.insertshaderinclude.md) | Insert shader includes after another shader include. |
|  [isHighPrecisionLineMaterial(material)](./harp-materials.ishighprecisionlinematerial.md) |  |
|  [isHighPrecisionPointMaterial(material)](./harp-materials.ishighprecisionpointmaterial.md) |  |
|  [setShaderDefine(defines, key, value)](./harp-materials.setshaderdefine.md) | Sets new value of 'define' regardless of current value set.<!-- -->Update <code>defines</code> map with new key and value, if key is already occupied it overrides its value. Helper function that may be used to setup \[\[THREE.ShaderMaterialParameters\]\] before material is create (i.e. in c-tor). |
|  [setShaderMaterialDefine(material, key, value)](./harp-materials.setshadermaterialdefine.md) | Setup material shader \_define\_ using two allowable semantics.<!-- -->Function accepts two types of values for shader preprocessor \_define\_: - \[\[boolean\]\], simple \[\[true\]\] or \[\[false\]\] which causes \_define\_ to be set with empty string, such defines may be handled in the shader using \_\_\#ifdef\_\_ semantics:
```
#ifdef SOME_DEFINE && !defined(OTHER_DEFINE)
// do something
#endif

```
- \[\[number\]\] which sets \_define\_ to explicit value. You may use it to enable/disable some code or even set compile time constants affecting shaders math:
```
#if SOME_DEFINE_SWITCH && OTHER_DEFINE_SWITCH == 0
gl_FragColor = vec4(1, 1, 1, DEFINE_ALPHA)
#endif

```
 Setting \_define\_ with <code>false</code> value is not the same as setting is with number value of <code>0</code>. |

## Interfaces

|  Interface | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [CirclePointsMaterialParameters](./harp-materials.circlepointsmaterialparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new \[\[HighPrecisionPointMaterial\]\]. |
|  [DisplacementFeature](./harp-materials.displacementfeature.md) | Interface to be implemented by materials that use displacement maps to overlay geometry on elevation data. |
|  [DisplacementFeatureParameters](./harp-materials.displacementfeatureparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new implementor of \[\[DisplacementFeature\]\]. |
|  [EdgeMaterialParameters](./harp-materials.edgematerialparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new \[\[EdgeMaterial\]\]. |
|  [ExtrusionFeature](./harp-materials.extrusionfeature.md) | Base interface for all objects that should have animated extrusion effect. The implementation of the actual ExtrusionFeature is done with the help of the mixin class \[\[ExtrusionFeatureMixin\]\] and a set of supporting functions in the namespace of the same name. |
|  [ExtrusionFeatureParameters](./harp-materials.extrusionfeatureparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new implementor of \[\[ExtrusionFeature\]\]. |
|  [FadingFeature](./harp-materials.fadingfeature.md) | Base interface for all objects that should fade in the distance. The implementation of the actual FadingFeature is done with the help of the mixin class \[\[FadingFeatureMixin\]\] and a set of supporting functions in the namespace of the same name. |
|  [FadingFeatureParameters](./harp-materials.fadingfeatureparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new implementor of \[\[FadingFeature\]\]. |
|  [ForcedBlending](./harp-materials.forcedblending.md) |  |
|  [HiddenThreeJSMaterialProperties](./harp-materials.hiddenthreejsmaterialproperties.md) | Material properties used from THREE, which may not be defined in the type. |
|  [HighPrecisionLineMaterialParameters](./harp-materials.highprecisionlinematerialparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new \[\[SolidLineMaterial\]\]. |
|  [HighPrecisionPointMaterialParameters](./harp-materials.highprecisionpointmaterialparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new \[\[HighPrecisionPointMaterial\]\]. |
|  [IconMaterialParameters](./harp-materials.iconmaterialparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new \[\[IconMaterial\]\]. |
|  [ShadowFeatureParameters](./harp-materials.shadowfeatureparameters.md) | Parameter used to control patching the standard material shader to ensure that the materials color isn't affected by the light direction, only valid for techniques that are "fill" |
|  [SolidLineMaterialParameters](./harp-materials.solidlinematerialparameters.md) | Parameters used when constructing a new \[\[SolidLineMaterial\]\]. |
